sanskrit_verse:
संन्यस्य सर्वकर्माणि कर्मदोषानपानुदन् ।
नियतो वेदमभ्यस्य पुत्रैश्वर्ये सुखं वसेत् ॥ ६.९५॥
transliteration:
saṃnasya sarvakarmāṇi karmadoṣānapānudan .
niyato vedamabhyasya putraiśvare sukhaṃ vaset .. 6.95 ..
sph_interpretive_translation: One who has renounced all actions and purified oneself of the defects of action, being disciplined in Vedic study, resides in sovereignty over progeny with bliss.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from renunciation of personal desire in action
Causation is purified through abandonment of karmic residue
Capacity-based responsibility arises from sustained Vedic discipline
Restoration logic aligns individual consciousness with cosmic order
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent renounces personal motive in action THEN eligibility for sovereign authority IS granted
IF karmic impurity IS removed THEN causal clarity IS restored
IF Vedas are studied with discipline THEN jurisdiction over lineage IS validated
IF consciousness IS aligned with dharma THEN inheritance rights ARE secured non-contentiously
supreme_court_application: In matters concerning ancestral authority or spiritual succession, the threshold of responsibility lies in demonstrable renunciation of egoic motivation and consistent engagement with Vedic knowledge. The court must recognize that true inheritors are those whose actions no longer generate karmic entanglement, thus restoring lawful capacity automatically.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that action devoid of desire naturally dissolves karmic distortion. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures that purification precedes sovereignty. Responsibility flows from inner alignment rather than external enforcement. There is no punishment because misalignment merely delays accession until rectification occurs organically through conscious effort.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process: guide claimant toward full renunciation of outcome attachment
Implement purification protocol: remove residual karmic impressions via śraddhā-based ritual observance
Reintegrate capacity: establish daily Vedic practice under qualified supervision
Assume sovereignty gradually: validate lineage rights upon demonstrable mastery of desireless action
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands established: sovereignty emerges only when action transcends desire. Dharma is restored through conscious alignment, not punitive correction. Reality reflects the supremacy of awakened consciousness as the sole arbiter of rightful inheritance.
